page.title: 14 LOCAL ISSUES:STRATFORD AREA
page.content: THE CONCERNS OF SUBURBAN STRATFORD INCLUDE: THE NEED TO HELP THE ELDERLY, PERHAPS BY PROVIDING MORE SHOPS IN RES- IDENTIAL AREAS, THE STATE OF THE HOSPITAL AND TRAFFIC PROBLEMS. TRAFFIC DENSITY IS HIGH DUE TO TOUR- ISM,AND HEAVY GOODS VEHICLES CROSSING THE AVON.MOST PEOPLE THINK THE SHOPS IN STRATFORD ARE ADEQUATE BUT EXPENSIVE AS THE NUMEROUS TOURISTS ARE WILLING TO PAY HIGH PRICES.A LARGER EMERGENCY UNIT AT THE HOSPITAL WOULD MAKE IT MORE EFF- ICIENT AS THE NEXT NEAREST HOSPITAL IS 10 MILES AWAY. ALSO THE PLIGHT OF NEIGHBOURING VILL- AGES IS WORRYING.LUDDINGTON IS TROUBLED BY SMELLS FROM THE SEWAGE PLANT-THERE HAVE BEEN COMPLAINTS,MEETINGS,AND PET- ITIONS.ROAD ACCIDENTS HAVE MADE A SPEED LIMIT PROPOSAL POPULAR.CLIFFORD CHAM- BERS HAS NO SHOP OR SCHOOL AND MAY BE- COME A DORMITORY VILLAGE TO STRATFORD.
